descriptive_name: Environmentally preferable packaging for the products that you produce (recycled content, less volume, reusable packaging)

Substituting environmental preferable direct materials or supplies for harmful or non-renewable ones
Providing design specification to suppliers in line with environmental requirements (e.g. green purchasing, black list of raw materials)

Working with customers to help them achieve environmental objectives
Complying with a customer’s supplier code of conduct
Starting or maintaining a formal M/WBE supplier purchase program
Reducing waste in internal processes (e.g., improving yield or efficiency)
Life-cycle analysis of the “cradle to grave” environmental impact of materials/products
Incorporating environmental considerations in evaluating and selecting suppliers
Decreasing the likelihood or impact of an environmental accident
Pollution prevention (eliminating emissions or waste)
Giving preference to materials with third party certifications, such as Green Seal, FSC or Energy Star
Environmental improvements in the disposition of your organization’s equipment
Purchasing from minority- or women-owned business enterprise (M/WBE) suppliers
Visiting suppliers’ plants or ensuring that they are not using sweatshop labor
Improving the workforce environment (e.g., indoor air quality)
Encouraging suppliers to improve the environmental performance of their processes
Involvement of suppliers in the re-design of internal processes (e.g. remanufacturing, reduction of by-products)
Co-development with suppliers to reduce the environmental impact of the product (e.g. eco-design, green packaging, recyclability)
Reduction/avoidance of land consumption
Carbon tracking/carbon footprint calculation of supply chain
Remediation projects, such as cleanup or restoration from past practices

We have laid out the shop floor so that processes and machines are in close proximity to each other.
The layout of our shop floor facilitates low inventories and fast throughput.
Our processes are located close together, so that material handling and part storage are minimized.
We have located our machines to support JIT production flow.
Our suppliers deliver to us on a just-in-time basis.
We receive daily shipments from most suppliers.
Our suppliers are linked with us by a pull system.
Suppliers fill our kanban containers, rather than filling purchase orders.
